intro: Bidens exaristata, commonly known as the roughleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes and wetlands. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it its common name, while its flowers are yellow with prominent white markings. Bidens exaristata is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
